intro: Kotschya africana var. africana, commonly known as African kotschya, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for arid and semi-arid regions. This species is also valued for its ornamental appeal and traditional uses in local communities.
